title: Variables leaking from setup_environment?
body:
@alalazo 

I want to add the env var `PISM_BIN` to a single module.  I added the following to `pism/package.py`:
```
    def setup_environment(self, spack_env, env):
        """Add <prefix>/bin to the module; this is not the default if we
        extend python."""
        env.prepend_path('PATH', join_path(self.prefix, 'bin'))
        env.set('PISM_PREFIX', self.prefix)
        env.set('PISM_BIN', join_path(self.prefix, 'bin', ''))
```

The result is the `PISM_BIN` variable got copied to many modules.  For example:
```
$ grep PISM_BIN ~/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/*
/home2/rpfische/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/icebin-develop-gcc-4.9.3-z7c3fls:setenv PISM_BIN "/home2/rpfische/spack5/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/pism-dev-d7jqt5feieehbqavwrmpbibd3oezglli/bin"
/home2/rpfische/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/icebin-develop-gcc-4.9.3-z7c3fls:setenv PISM_BIN "/home2/rpfische/spack5/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/pism-dev-d7jqt5feieehbqavwrmpbibd3oezglli/bin"
/home2/rpfische/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/modele-landice-gcc-4.9.3-p2z7gtp:setenv PISM_BIN "/home2/rpfische/spack5/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/pism-dev-d7jqt5feieehbqavwrmpbibd3oezglli/bin"
/home2/rpfische/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/modele-landice-gcc-4.9.3-p2z7gtp:setenv PISM_BIN "/home2/rpfische/spack5/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/pism-dev-d7jqt5feieehbqavwrmpbibd3oezglli/bin"
/home2/rpfische/spack5/share/spack/modules/linux-centos7-x86_64/pism-dev-gcc-4.9.3-d7jqt5f:setenv PISM_BIN "/home2/rpfische/spack5/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/pism-dev-d7jqt5feieehbqavwrmpbibd3oezglli/bin/"
```

Am I doing something wrong (and this is the correct behavior of Spack)?  Or is this a bug?  How do I get `PISM_BIN` in just one module?
